snippet: The Houthi rebels who seized the capital in January said they would take control of the country, which does not now have a functioning government.
abstract: Yemen's Houthi rebels, who have already forced resignations of president and cabinet, say they plan to also replace Parliament with national council which will choose new president; critics say move is undemocratic.
lead_paragraph: The Houthi rebels who seized the capital in January said they would take control of the country, which does not now have a functioning government.

headline.main: Rebels in Yemen Say They Intend to Form a New Government
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Yemen Say They Intend to Form a New Government

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
